groups.description: Checks related to JavaScript usage.
groups.name: check_javascript_usage

checks.description: Detect usage of JavaScript libraries with known vulnerabilities.
checks.name: check_for_vulnerable_javascript_library_usage

groups.description:
Splunk Packaging Toolkit (SLIM) validation
This group uses slim to extend the cloud checks for improved auto-vetting.
groups.name: check_slim_ssai

checks.description:
Find non-standard config files and notify app developers to confirm that
 1. those files are safe to install.
 2. those files are partitioned to the expected instances.
checks.name: check_custom_confs

checks.description: Check that inputs.conf.spec does not include modular inputs that perform management tasks.
checks.name: check_for_modular_inputs

messages.message: File: app.manifest was found, skipping this check.

checks.description: Check that nested apps do not exist as they are not valid for self-service install.
checks.name: check_for_nested_apps

checks.description: Check that nested archives do not exist as they are not valid for self-service install.
checks.name: check_for_nested_archives

checks.description: Check that inputs.conf does not include scripted inputs that perform management tasks.
checks.name: check_for_scripted_inputs

messages.message: File: app.manifest was found, skipping this check.

checks.description:
Check that apps can be validated by SLIM or reject, since invalid apps can't
 be installed in Classic Splunk Cloud.
checks.name: check_that_app_passes_slim_validation_for_cloud

checks.description: Check that the provided app package is not .zip type for SSAI purpose
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_type_is_not_zip_type

groups.description: Malware, viruses, malicious content, user security standards (dynamic checks)
groups.name: check_viruses

checks.description: Check that the app does not include viruses.
checks.name: check_for_viruses

groups.description:
Splunk app packaging standards
These checks validate that a Splunk app has been correctly packaged, and can be provided safely for package validation.
groups.name: check_packaging_standards

checks.description: Check that the package is compressed correctly.
checks.name: check_package_compression

checks.description: Check that the extracted Splunk App contains a default/app.conf file.
checks.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_contains_default_app_conf_file

checks.description:
Check that the extracted Splunk App does not contain any files with incorrect permissions. Files must have the
 owner's permissions include read and write (600).
checks.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_does_not_contain_files_with_invalid_permissions

checks.description:
Check that the extracted Splunk App does not contain any directories with incorrect permissions. Directories and
 subdirectories must have the owner's permissions set to r/w/x (700).
checks.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_does_not_contain_invalid_directories

checks.description:
Check that the extracted Splunk App does not contain any directories or
 files that start with a ., or directories that start with __MACOSX.
checks.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_does_not_contain_prohibited_directories_or_files

checks.description:
Check that the Splunk App package does not contain any non-app files. Files within a valid app folder or valid
 dependencies within a .dependencies folder are permitted, all other files are not.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_does_not_contain_files_outside_of_app

checks.description: Check that the compressed artifact extracts to a directory that does not start with a . character.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_extracts_to_visible_directory

checks.description:
Check that the Splunk app provided does not contain incorrect permissions.
 Packages must have the owner's read permission set to r (400).
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_has_read_permission

checks.description:
Check that the Splunk App package contains only valid dependencies.
 Dependencies are valid if a .dependencies directory contains only valid
 app packages inside.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_has_valid_static_dependencies

messages.message: No ../.dependencies folder found. Please check that the Splunk App package contains only valid dependencies.

checks.description: Check that the Splunk app provided does not start with a . character.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_name_does_not_start_with_period

checks.description: Check that the Splunk app provided a valid compressed file.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_valid_compressed_file

checks.description: Check that the Splunk App package with a .dependencies directory also contains exactly one valid app folder.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_with_static_dependencies_has_exactly_one_app_folder

messages.message: No ../.dependencies folder found. Please add a .dependencies directory with an valid app folder.

checks.description: Check that the extracted Splunk App contains a default/app.conf file that contains an [id] or [launcher] stanza with a version property that is formatted as Major.Minor.Revision.
checks.name: check_valid_version_number

checks.description: Check that the app does not use Adobe Flash files.
checks.name: check_requires_adobe_flash

checks.description: Check that the extracted Splunk App does not contain only app.conf
checks.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_does_not_contains_only_app_conf_file

checks.description:
Check that the Splunk App package with a .dependencies directory also
 contains an app folder with an app.manifest.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_with_static_dependencies_has_app_manifest

messages.message: No ../.dependencies folder found. Please add a .dependencies directory that contains an app folder with an app.manifest.

groups.description:
Authentication.conf file standards
Ensure that bindDNpassword is not specified. For more, see authentication.conf.
groups.name: check_authentication_configuration_file

checks.description: Check that all map roles defined in authentication.conf do not map to splunk-system-role.
checks.name: check_role_map_should_not_map_splunk_system_role

checks.description: Check that saml-* stanzas in authentication.conf do not turn off signedAssertion property.
checks.name: check_saml_auth_should_not_turn_off_signed_assertion

checks.description: Check that all the scripted authentications defined in authentication.conf are explicitly set the python.version to python3.
checks.name: check_scripted_authentication_has_valid_python_version_property

groups.description:
Authorize.conf file standards
Ensure that the authorize configuration file located in the /default folder is well-formed and valid. For more, see authorize.conf.
groups.name: check_authorize_configuration_file

checks.description: Check that authorize.conf does not contain any modified capabilities.
checks.name: check_authorize_conf_capability_not_modified

groups.description: Binary file standards
groups.name: check_binary_files

checks.description: Checks that binaries that are distributed to the IDX tier of a distributed Splunk platform deployment are compatible with aarch64.
checks.name: check_idx_binary_compatibility

groups.description:
Cloud operations simple application check
This group serves to help validate simple applications in an effort to try and automate the validation process for cloud operations.
groups.name: check_cloud_simple_app

checks.description: Check that commands referenced in the alert.execute.cmd property of all alert actions are checked for compliance with Splunk Cloud security policy. Prevent alert_actions.conf from being used to execute malicious commands.
checks.name: check_alert_actions_conf_for_alert_execute_cmd_properties

checks.description: Check that authorize.conf does not grant excessive administrative permissions to the user. Prevent roles from gaining unauthorized permissions.
checks.name: check_authorize_conf_admin_all_objects_privileges

checks.description: Check that directories under data/ui contain only allowed files. Ensure unnecessary, unwanted files are not bundled in the app inappropriately.
checks.name: check_default_data_ui_file_allow_list

checks.description: Check that directories under data/ui contain only allowed files. Identify for manual review items that might cause passwords to be stored in plaintext.
checks.name: check_default_data_ui_manager_for_plain_text_credentials

checks.description: Check if concerningReplicatedFileSize in distsearch.conf is larger than 50 MB.
checks.name: check_distsearch_conf_for_concerning_replicated_file_size

checks.description: Check that authorize.conf does not contain importRoles and grantableRoles for any built-in roles. Modifying the inheritance of the default roles in Splunk can have potentially severe consequences, including privilege escalation.
checks.name: check_import_roles_and_grantable_roles_for_builtin_roles

checks.description: Check that indexes defined in indexes.conf use relative paths starting with $SPLUNK_DB
checks.name: check_indexes_conf_only_uses_splunk_db_variable

checks.description:
Check that batch input has required attributes.
 The following key/value pairs are required for batch inputs:
 move_policy = sinkhole
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_batch_has_required_attributes

checks.description:
Check that batch input accesses files in a permitted way.
To be permissible, the batch input must meet the following criteria:
 1) The file path needs to match a file in the directory "$SPLUNK_HOME/var/spool/splunk/"
 2) The file name needs to be application specific "$SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/"
 3) The file name should not end with "stash" or "stash_new"
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_batch

checks.description: Check that lookups/ contains only approved file types (.csv, .csv.default, .csv.gz, .csv.tgz, .kmz) or files formatted as valid csv. Ensure malicious files are not passed off as lookup files.
checks.name: check_lookups_allow_list

checks.description: Check that the metadata/ and users/<username>/metadata directories do not contain any subdirectories and only contain .meta files. Ensure malicious files are not passed off as metadata files.
checks.name: check_metadata_allow_list

checks.description: Check that python version is python3 for scripted inputs defined in inputs.conf.
checks.name: check_scripted_inputs_python_version

checks.description: Check that setup.xml does not exist in the app default or local folders.
checks.name: check_setup_xml

checks.description: Check that only role-mapping stanza is allowed in authentication.conf as long as it doesn't map users to a cloud-internal role.
checks.name: check_stanza_of_authentication_conf

checks.description: Check that the static/ directory does not contains any subdirectories and contains only known file types. Ensure malicious files are not passed off as metadata files.
checks.name: check_static_directory_file_allow_list

checks.description: Check that the app does not create audit.
checks.name: check_audit_conf_deny_list

checks.description: Check that authorize.conf does not contain a [tokens_auth] stanza
checks.name: check_authorize_conf_for_tokens_auth

checks.description: Check that the app does not create bookmarks.
checks.name: check_bookmarks_conf_deny_list

checks.description:
Check that custom search commands have an executable or script per

checks.description: Check that the app does not create datatypesbnf.
checks.name: check_datatypesbnf_conf_deny_list

checks.description: Check that the app does not create default-mode.
checks.name: check_default_mode_conf_deny_list

checks.description: Check that the app does not create deploymentclient.
checks.name: check_deploymentclient_conf_deny_list

checks.description: Check that the app does not create deployment.
checks.name: check_deployment_conf_deny_list

checks.description:
Check that all executable binary files have matching source code. For any binary files, there
 should be a source code provided with the same name. Or, there should be a declaration of what the
 binary file is all about in the app's README. Details for passing this check will be returned if you fail
 it.

checks.name: check_for_index_volume_usage

checks.description: Check that default/inputs.conf or local/inputs.conf or users/<username>/local/inputs.conf does not contain any fifo:// stanzas.
checks.name: check_for_inputs_fifo_usage

Check whether the app contains java files. Java files will be inspected

Check if the app contains Perl scripts. Perl scripts will be inspected

Check whether the app contains shell files. Shell files will be manually inspected

checks.description: Check that inputs.conf does not contain a [http] stanza

checks.description: Apps cannot ship a configured HEC token in inputs.conf. HEC tokens must be created by stack admins via ACS. Refer: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.1.0/Data/UsetheHTTPEventCollectorRemove [http://] stanza from inputs.conf.

checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_tcp

checks.description: Check that inputs.conf does not have any UDP inputs.

groups.description:
Checking for Front-end Libraries
This check looks for various front-end libraries inside of apps. 
As of 03/23/2022, we are looking at Splunk UI, and it's predecessor, SplunkJS.
This is currently an INFORMATIONAL Check. 
Updated on 04/17/2023
This check now is expanded to look for several other critical front-end libraries. 
1. We have expanded the regex matching to be more inline with all the UDF Packages https://splunkui.splunk.com/Packages/dashboard-docs/?path=%2FFAQ
2. We have added a few other critical packages (@splunk/react-search, @splunk/react-time-range, @splunk/search-job, @splunk/ui-utils, @splunk/splunk-utils, @splunk/moment)
3. We have expanded the regex matching to be more inline with more of the Visualizations packages.
groups.name: check_frontend_libraries

Check that the app files are not importing files directly from the

groups.description:
Limits.conf file standards
Ensure that /default/limits.conf or local/limits.conf file is omitted.
When included in the app, the limits.conf file changes the limits that are placed on the system for hardware use and memory consumption, which is a task that should be handled by Splunk administrators and not by Splunk app developers. For more, see limits.conf.
groups.name: check_limits_configuration_file

checks.description: Check that default/limits.conf or local/limits.conf or users/<username>/local/limits/conf has not been included.
checks.name: check_limits_conf

groups.description:
Outputs.conf file standards
Ensure that the outputs.conf file located in the /default folder of the app is well-formed and valid. For more, see outputs.conf.
groups.name: check_outputs_configuration_file

checks.description:
Check Dashboard XML files for <option> element with the deprecated option value "refresh.auto.interval"
 i.e. <option name="refresh.auto.interval">
checks.name: check_for_dashboard_xml_option_element_with_deprecated_attribute_value

checks.description:
Checks that views are not importing splunkjs/mvc/headerview or splunkjs/mvc/footerrview.
 These are replaced by LayoutView in Splunk 6.5. LayoutView is not backwards compatible to Splunk 6.4 or earlier.
 Only use LayoutView if you are only targeting Splunk 6.5 or above.
checks.name: check_for_splunk_js_header_and_footer_view

groups.description:
Deprecated or removed features from Splunk Enterprise 6.6
The following features should not be supported in Splunk 6.6 or later. For more, see Deprecated features and Changes for Splunk App developers.
groups.name: check_splunk_6_6_deprecated_features

checks.description: Check removed support for setting autoLB in outputs.conf
checks.name: check_for_autolb_setting_in_outputs_conf

checks.description: Check apps/appinstall usages
checks.name: check_for_app_install_endpoint

checks.description:
Check existence for displayRowNumbers option in simple xml. This option
 is no longer supported since Splunk 6.6.
checks.name: check_for_displayrownumbers_in_simple_xml

groups.description:
Deprecated features from Splunk Enterprise 7.1
The following features should not be supported in Splunk 7.1 or later. For more, see Deprecated features and Changes for Splunk App developers.
groups.name: check_splunk_7_1_deprecated_features

checks.description: Check for use of input SPL command in .conf files and SimpleXML.
checks.name: check_for_input_command_usage

groups.description:
Deprecated features from Splunk Enterprise 7.2
The following features should not be supported in Splunk 7.2 or later. For more, see Deprecated features and Changes for Splunk App developers.
groups.name: check_splunk_7_2_deprecated_features

checks.description: Check deprecated literals.conf existence.
checks.name: check_for_deprecated_literals_conf

groups.description:
Deprecated features from Splunk Enterprise 7.3
The following features should not be supported in Splunk 7.3 or later. For more, see Deprecated features and Changes for Splunk App developers.
groups.name: check_splunk_7_3_deprecated_features

checks.description: Check for use of tscollect SPL command in .conf files and SimpleXML.
checks.name: check_for_tscollect_command_usage

groups.description:
Deprecated features from Splunk Enterprise 8.0
The following features should not be supported in Splunk 8.0.0 or later. For more, see Deprecated features and Changes for Splunk App developers.
groups.name: check_splunk_8_0_deprecated_features

checks.description: Check that there is no Advanced XML, which was deprecated in Splunk Enterprise 6.3.
checks.name: check_for_advanced_xml_module_elements

checks.description: Check for the existence of custom CherryPy endpoints, which must be upgraded tobe Python 3-compatible for the Splunk Enterprise 8.0.
checks.name: check_for_cherry_py_custom_controller_web_conf_endpoints

checks.description:
Check for the existence of Python code block in Mako templates, which must be upgraded
 to be Python 3-compatible for the Splunk Enterprise 8.0.
checks.name: check_for_existence_of_python_code_block_in_mako_template

checks.description:
Check for the existence of Python scripts, which must be upgraded to be cross-compatible
 with Python 2 and 3 for Splunk Enterprise 8.0.
checks.name: check_for_python_script_existence

checks.description: Check for the existence of the M2Crypto package usage, which is removed in the Splunk Enterprise 8.0.
checks.name: check_for_removed_m2crypto_usage

groups.description:
Deprecated features from Splunk Enterprise 9.0.1
The following features should not be supported in Splunk 9.0.1 or later. For more, see Deprecated features and Changes for Splunk App developers.
groups.name: check_splunk_9_0_deprecated_features

checks.description: Check search v1 deprecated API usages
checks.name: check_for_search_v1_endpoint

groups.description:
Web.conf File Standards
Ensure that web.conf is safe for cloud deployment and that any exposed
patterns match endpoints defined by the app - apps should not expose endpoints
other than their own.
Including web.conf can have adverse impacts for cloud. Allow only
[endpoint:*] and [expose:*] stanzas, with expose only containing pattern=
and methods= properties.
- web.conf
groups.name: check_web_configuration_file

checks.description: Check that web.conf only defines [endpoint:] and [expose:]stanzas, with [expose:*] only containing pattern= and methods=.
checks.name: check_web_conf

groups.description:
Modular inputs structure and standards
Modular inputs are configured in an inputs.conf.spec file located in the /README directory of the app. For more, see Modular inputs overview, Modular inputs configuration, and Modular inputs basic example.
groups.name: check_modular_inputs

checks.description: Check that all the modular inputs defined in inputs.conf.spec explicitly set the python.version to python3.
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_spec_stanzas_has_python_version_property

groups.description: JSON file standards
groups.name: check_json_files

checks.description: Check that all JSON files are well-formed.
checks.name: check_validate_json_data_is_well_formed

groups.description:
Lookup file standards
Lookups add fields from an external source to events based on the values of fields that are already present in those events.
groups.name: check_lookup_files

checks.description: Check that no two files/directories under the lookups directory have this naming pattern respectively:xxx and xxx.default - with the only difference in the .default extension.During the installation of an app in Splunk Cloud, a lookup file will be temporarily renamed to append an additional.default extension to it, which will cause error if a namesake file already exists.
checks.name: check_for_lookups_file_name

groups.description:
Saved search standards
Saved searches are defined in a savedsearches.conf file located in the /default and /local directory of the app. For more, see Save and share your reports and savedsearches.conf.
groups.name: check_saved_searches

checks.description: check that savedsearches.conf searches are cron scheduledreasonably. Less than five asterisks should be used.
checks.name: check_for_gratuitous_cron_scheduling

checks.description: Check that no real-time pre-index saved searches are being used insavedsearches.conf. Real-time pre-index saved searches are extremelysystem intensive and should be avoided.
checks.name: check_for_real_time_saved_searches_for_cloud

checks.description: Check that savedsearch.conf stanzas do not contain action.script.filename option
checks.name: check_for_sched_saved_searches_action_script_filename

checks.description: Check that if a scheduled saved search in savedsearch.conf contains dispatch.earliest_time option, or if a scheduled saved search with auto summary enabled contains auto_summarize.dispatch.earliest_time option
checks.name: check_for_sched_saved_searches_earliest_time

checks.description: Check that if a savedsearch.conf stanza contains scheduling optionsit does contain a dispatch.latest_time
checks.name: check_for_sched_saved_searches_latest_time

checks.description: Check that savedsearch.conf stanza do not contain action.populate_lookup option`.
checks.name: check_for_saved_searches_populate_lookup

groups.description:
App.conf standards
The app.conf file located at default/app.conf provides key application information and branding. For more, see app.conf.
groups.name: check_app_configuration_file

checks.description: Check that custom .conf files have a a matching conf_replication_include.<conf_file_name> value in server.conf, under the [shclustering] stanza, to ensure that configurations are synchronized across Search Head Clusters.
checks.name: check_custom_conf_replication

messages.message: App does not contain any custom config files.

checks.description: Check that id attribute under the package stanza in app.conf does not match with the Splunk Default App names
checks.name: check_for_default_splunk_app

checks.description: Check that default/app.conf, local/app.conf and all users/<username>/local/app.conf don't have a reload.<CONF_FILE>, where CONF_FILE is a non-custom conf. (https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Admin/Appconf#.5Btriggers.5D)
checks.name: check_for_trigger_stanza

checks.description: Check that the [package] stanza in app.conf has a valid id value.See https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Admin/Appconf for details.
checks.name: check_for_valid_package_id

checks.description: Check that the default/app.conf or local/app.conf or users/<username>/local/app.conf contains a label key value pair in the [ui] stanza and the length is between 5 and 80 characters inclusive.
checks.name: check_for_valid_ui_label

checks.description: Check that custom config files have a corresponding reload trigger in app.conf. Without a reload trigger the app will request a restart on any change to the config file, which may be a negative experience for end-users.
checks.name: check_reload_trigger_for_all_custom_confs

messages.message: App does not contain any custom config files.

checks.description:
Check in default/app.conf, 'local/app.conf' and each users/<username>/local/app.conf,
 that install_source_checksum not be set explicitly.
checks.name: check_no_install_source_checksum

checks.description:
Check in default/app.conf, 'local/app.conf' and each `users/<username/local/app.conf,
 that install_source_local_checksum not be set explicitly.
checks.name: check_no_install_source_local_checksum

checks.description: Check that default/app.conf setting is_configured = False.
checks.name: check_that_setup_has_not_been_performed

groups.description:
Directory structure standards
Ensure that the directories and files in the app adhere to hierarchy standards.
groups.name: check_application_structure

checks.description:
Check that the 'local' directory does not exist. All configuration
 should be in the 'default' directory.
checks.name: check_that_local_does_not_exist

checks.description: Check that app has no .conf or dashboard filenames that contain spaces. Splunk software does not support such files.
checks.name: check_filenames_for_spaces

checks.description:
Check that the file 'local.meta' does not exist. All metadata
 permissions should be set in 'default.meta'.
checks.name: check_for_local_meta

checks.description: Check that the app name does not start with digits
checks.name: check_that_app_name_config_is_valid

checks.description:
Check that local/passwords.conf or `users//local/passwords.conf does not exist.
 Password files are not transferable between instances.
checks.name: check_that_local_passwords_conf_does_not_exist

messages.message: The local directory does not exist.

groups.description:
Configuration file standards
Ensure that all configuration files located in the /default folder are well-formed and valid.
groups.name: check_configuration_files

checks.description: Check that the field.<name> type in collections.conf does not include boolean.Use bool instead.
checks.name: check_collections_conf_for_specified_name_field_type

checks.description:
Check that all config files parse cleanly - no trailing whitespace after
 continuations, no duplicated stanzas or options.
checks.name: check_config_file_parsing_public

checks.description:
Check that app conf files do not point to files outside the app container.
 Because hard-coded paths won't work in Splunk Cloud, we don't consider to
 check absolute paths.
checks.name: check_manipulation_outside_of_app_container

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain any .conf files that create global
 definitions using the [default] stanza.
checks.name: check_no_default_stanzas

groups.description:
Indexes.conf file standards
Ensure that the index configuration file located in the /default and /local folder is well-formed and valid. For more, see indexes.conf.
groups.name: check_indexes_configuration_file

checks.description: Check that all the coldToFrozenScript in indexes.conf are explicitly set the python.version to python3.
checks.name: check_coldToFrozenScript_has_valid_python_version_property

checks.description: Check that indexes.conf only contains the required 'homePath' , 'coldPath', and 'thawedPath' properties or the optional 'frozenTimePeriodInSecs', 'disabled', 'datatype' and 'repFactor' properties. All other properties are prohibited. Also, if repFactor property exists, it's value should be 'auto'. This check is cloud only because indexes are not allowed via check_indexes_conf_does_not_exist.
checks.name: check_indexes_conf_properties

checks.description: Check that all index names consist only of lowercase characters, numbers, underscores and hyphens. They cannot begin with an underscore or hyphen, or contain the word 'kvstore'. If index names have any uppercase characters any attempts to edit the index in the UI will cause a duplicate index stanza creation which will cause many errors in Splunk.
checks.name: check_lower_cased_index_names

checks.description: Check that no default Splunk indexes are modified by the app.
checks.name: check_validate_default_indexes_not_modified

groups.description:
Meta file standards
Ensure that all meta files located in the /metadata folder are well-formed and valid.
groups.name: check_meta_files

checks.description: Check that knowledge objects with access control restrictions defined in *.meta files are accessible to customers in Splunk Cloud.
checks.name: check_kos_are_accessible

groups.description:
Props Configuration file standards
Ensure that all props.conf files located in the default (or local) folder are well-formed and valid.

props.conf
transforms.conf
groups.name: check_props_configuration_file

checks.description: Check that pretrained sourctypes in props.confhave only 'TRANSFORM-' or 'SEDCMD' settings,and that those transforms only modify the host, source, or sourcetype.
checks.name: check_pretrained_sourcetypes_have_only_allowed_transforms

checks.description:
Check that the props.conf does not contain lookup() usage in INGEST_EVAL options.
 This feature is not available in Splunk Cloud.
For example:
[lookup1]
 INGEST_EVAL= status_detail=lookup("http_status.csv", json_object("status", status), json_array("status_description"))
checks.name: check_props_conf_has_no_ingest_eval_lookups

groups.description:
Server configuration file standards
Ensure that server.conf is well-formed and valid.
For detailed information about the server configuration file, see server.conf.
groups.name: check_server_configuration_file

checks.description: Check that server.conf in an app is only allowed to contain: 1. conf_replication_include.\<custom_conf_files> in [shclustering] stanza 2. or EXCLUDE-\<class> property in [diag] stanza,
checks.name: check_server_conf_only_contains_custom_conf_sync_stanzas_or_diag_stanza

groups.description:
Alert actions structure and standards
Custom alert actions are defined in an alert_actions.conf file located in the /default directory of the app. For more, see Custom alert actions overview and alert_actions.conf.
groups.name: check_alert_actions_config

checks.description:
Check that each custom alert action has a valid executable. If it does, further check
 if the executable is Python script. If it does, further check it's Python 3 compatible.
checks.name: check_alert_actions_exe_exist

checks.description: Check whether any custom alert actions have executable arguments.
checks.name: check_for_explicit_exe_args

checks.description:
Check that each custom alert action's payload format has a value of xml
 or json.
checks.name: check_for_payload_format

groups.description:
Custom search command structure and standards
Custom search commands are defined in a commands.conf file in the /default directory of the app. For more, see About writing custom search commands and commands.conf.
groups.name: check_custom_commands

checks.description: Check that commands.conf must explicitly define the python.version to be python3 for each python-scripted custom command.
checks.name: check_command_scripts_python_version

groups.description:
Custom workflow actions structure and standards
Custom workflow actions are defined in a workflow_actions.conf file in the /default directory of the app. For more, see About lookups and workflow_actions.conf.
groups.name: check_workflow_actions

checks.description: Check that for each workflow action in workflow_actions.conf the link.uri property uses the https protocol for external links. Unencrypted http is permitted for internal links.
checks.name: check_workflow_actions_link_uri_does_not_use_http_protocol

groups.description:
REST endpoints and handler standards
REST endpoints are defined in a restmap.conf file in the /default and /local directory of the app. For more, see restmap.conf.
groups.name: check_rest_endpoints

checks.description: Check that restmap.conf file exists at default/restmap.conf, local/restmap.conf and users//local/restmap.conf` when using REST endpoints.
checks.name: check_restmap_conf_exists

checks.description: Check that python.version is python3 for executables in restmap.conf.
checks.name: check_rest_handler_python_executable_exists

checks.description: Check that each stanza in restmap.conf has a matching handler script.if not, throw a warning.
checks.name: check_rest_handler_scripts_exist_for_cloud

groups.description:
Data model files and configurations
Data models are defined in a datamodels.conf file in the /default directory of the app. For more, see About data models and datamodels.conf.
groups.name: check_data_models_config

checks.description:
Check that the use of accelerated data models do not occur. If data model 
 acceleration is required, developers should provide directions in documentation
 for how to accelerate data models from within the Splunk Web GUI. 
 data model acceleration
checks.name: check_for_datamodel_acceleration

groups.description: Python file standards
groups.name: check_python_files

checks.description: Check that Splunk SDK for Python is up-to-date.
checks.name: check_python_sdk_version

messages.message: Splunk SDK for Python not found.

checks.description: Check all python files are well-formed under python2 and python3 standard
checks.name: check_all_python_files_are_well_formed

checks.description:
Check that the python __import__ method is not used in a way that
 can be exploited (e.g., import(conf_setting) is at risk of code
 injection).
checks.name: check_built_in_import_function

checks.description: Check for builtin functions(open, eval, execfile, file) usages in python files
checks.name: check_for_builtin_functions

checks.description: Check that there are no .pyc or .pyo files included in the app.
checks.name: check_for_compiled_python

checks.description: Check if custom python interpreters could be used in malicious code execution
checks.name: check_for_custom_python_interpreters

checks.description: check if data compression and archiving libraries could be used to read & write files outside of app dir
checks.name: check_for_data_compression_and_archiving

checks.description: check for data persistence usage which could be used to invoke marshall function call
checks.name: check_for_data_persistence

checks.description: Check if debugging library could be used to execute arbitrary commands
checks.name: check_for_debugging_and_profiling

checks.description: Check for possible file and directory access, they could be used in external file manipulation
checks.name: check_for_file_and_directory_access

checks.description: check if generic operating system modules could be used to communicate with outside services, files or systems
checks.name: check_for_generic_operating_system_services

checks.description: Check that there are no hidden python files included in the app.
checks.name: check_for_hidden_python_files

checks.description: Check Python code for importing modules dynamically.
checks.name: check_for_importing_modules

checks.description: Check for the use of web server classes, they could be used to start an internal server in current app
checks.name: check_for_internet_protocols_and_support

checks.description: check if networking or file manipulation exist in interprocess modules usage
checks.name: check_for_interprocess_communication_and_networking

checks.description: Check for operating system features that are available on selected operating systems only.
checks.name: check_for_optional_operating_system_services

checks.description: check for plain text credentials disclosure in python files
checks.name: check_for_plain_text_credentials_in_python

checks.description:
Check for the use of threading, and multiprocesses. Threading or process must be
 used with discretion and not negatively affect the Splunk installation as a
 whole.
checks.name: check_for_possible_threading

checks.description: Check if program frameworks could be used to interface with web part
checks.name: check_for_program_frameworks

checks.description: Check if multimedia services module could be used to execute unknown-source multimedia files
checks.name: check_for_python_multimedia_services

checks.description: Check if python runtime services could be used to manipulate system python objects
checks.name: check_for_python_runtime_services

checks.description: Check for UDP network communication
checks.name: check_for_python_udp_network_communications

checks.description: Check if restricted execution exist in current app
checks.name: check_for_restricted_execution

checks.description: check if possible reverse shell exist in python code
checks.name: check_for_reverse_shell_and_backdoor

checks.description: Check possible root privilege escalation
checks.name: check_for_root_privilege_escalation

checks.description: Check that all network communications are encrypted
checks.name: check_for_unencrypted_network_communications

checks.description: Check python httplib2 version.
checks.name: check_python_httplib2_version

checks.description: Check for untrusted xml usages in python libraries
checks.name: check_python_untrusted_xml_functions

groups.description:
addon_builder.conf standards
The addon_builder.conf file located at default/addon_builder.conf provides the information about the Add-on Builder associated with the Splunk App.
groups.name: check_addon_builder_config

checks.description: Checks that the addon_builder.conf contains an builder version number between 4.1.4 and 4.2.0 in the [base] stanza. Ensure that apps built with Add-on Builder are maintained with an up-to-date version of Add-on Builder.
checks.name: check_for_addon_builder_version

groups.description: Bias language (static checks)
groups.name: check_bias_language

checks.description: Check that the app does not include any bias words.
checks.name: check_for_bias_language

groups.description: Malware, viruses, malicious content, user security standards (static checks)
groups.name: check_malware

checks.description: Check that no sensitive hostnames/IPs are stored in the app.
checks.name: check_hostnames_and_ips

messages.message: PUBLIC IP 185.16.111.4 is found in README.md:21 File: README.md Line Number: 21
PUBLIC IP 185.16.111.7 is found in README.md:24 File: README.md Line Number: 24

groups.description: Operating system standards
groups.name: check_potentially_harmful_operations

checks.description:
Check for the use of malicious shell commands in configuration files or shell scripts to
 corrupt the OS or Splunk instance. Other scripting languages are covered by other checks.
checks.name: check_destructive_commands

groups.description: Security vulnerabilities
groups.name: check_security

checks.description:
Check for environment variable manipulation and attempts to monitor
 sensitive environment variables.
checks.name: check_for_environment_variable_use_in_python

checks.description: Check for insecure HTTP calls in Python.
checks.name: check_for_insecure_http_calls_in_python

checks.description: Check for passwords and secrets.
checks.name: check_for_secret_disclosure

checks.description: Check for sensitive information being exposed in transit via URL query string parameters
checks.name: check_for_sensitive_info_in_url

checks.description: Check that all outgoing connections use TLS in accordance to Splunk Cloud Platform policy.
checks.name: check_for_supported_tls

checks.description: Check no symlink points to the file outside this app
checks.name: check_symlink_outside_app

groups.description: Source code and binaries standards
groups.name: check_source_and_binaries

checks.description:
Check that files outside the bin/ and appserver/controllers directory do not have execute
 permissions.
 Splunk Cloud is a Linux-based platform, Splunk recommends 644 for all app files outside the bin/ directory, 644 for
 scripts within the bin/ directory that are invoked using an interpreter (e.g. python my_script.py
 or sh my_script.sh), and 755 for scripts within the bin/ directory that are invoked directly
 (e.g. ./my_script.sh or ./my_script).
checks.name: check_for_bin_files

checks.description:
Check that files outside the bin/ directory do not appear to be
 executable according to the Unix file command. From man file: files have
 a ``magic number'' stored in a particular place near the beginning of the
 file that tells the UNIX operating system that the file is a binary
 executable.
checks.name: check_for_executable_flag

groups.description: XML file standards
groups.name: check_xml_files

checks.description:
Check any XML files that embed JavaScript via CDATA for compliance
 with Splunk Cloud security policy.
checks.name: check_for_xml_embedded_javascript

checks.description: Check that all XML files are well-formed.
checks.name: check_that_all_xml_files_are_well_formed
